alert.note: Alert for North Itasca (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 08 at 6:18PM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF EAST CENTRAL ITASCA AND WEST CENTRAL ST. LOUIS COUNTIES THROUGH 645 PM CDT... At 618 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 11 miles south of Togo, or 19 miles northwest of Hibbing, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds gusts up to 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow unsecured objects around. Minor hail damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of east central Itasca and west central St. Louis Counties, including the following locations... Side Lake, Snake Trail, Kinney, Stingy Lake, Idington, Perch Lake and Mcarthy Beach State Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Anyone outdoors, including anyone on or in the water, should seek shelter inside a sturdy building or hard topped vehicle.
